ISLMID-NOTES: 

CIVWARMID: MID4371 1 -- civil war MID
CIVWARMID-CER: MID4371 1 -- certain 
CIVWARMID-NOTES: MID4371 from cm narrative, Ivory Coast war planes bombed french military planes at an airport in Ivory Coast. French military units were in Ivory Coast acting as peacekeepers between the Ivory Coast government and rebel factions. From NYT 11/7/2004, an American civilian was also killed, bringing the US into this MID. The Ivory Coast refused to apologize for the airstrike that killed an American. Coded civil war MID because civil war activity in Ivory Coast drove this MID.

MID4 2002-2010:

MID4371
rivalry=2437 nationa=IVORY COAST nationb=USA MID4371 20041106-20041106 
 revtype1a=POLICY revtype2a=NOT APPLICABLE fatala=NONE fatalpa=0 lhosta=USE OF FORCE 
 revtype1b=NOT APPLICABLE revtype2b=NOT APPLICABLE fatalb=NONE fatalpb=0 lhostb=
NO MILITARIZED ACTION 

On November 6, 2004, Ivory Coast war planes bombed French military units at an airport in Ivory Coast. The French military units were in Ivory Coast acting as peacekeepers between Ivorian government and rebel factions. Following the attack, Ivorian ground units exchanged fire with French units before retreating. In response to the two attacks, the French forces on the ground destroyed 2 Ivorian fighter jets at the airport, and France sent three fighter jets to the Gabonese capital Libreville in case of further attacks. First day of dispute was on 11/6/2004 and last day of dispute was on 11/6/2004.

SOURCES

Somini Sengupta. "Ivory Coast Violence Flares; 9 French and 1 US Death." New York Times 11/7/2004. Accessed 6/3/2017. http://www.nytimes.com/2004/11/07/world/africa/ivory-coast-violence-flares-9-french-and-1-us-death.html
